result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian Lee Bearheart

records.addlTxt:
11:01 AM Cases 19CF269, 2021CF000154, 2021CF000262, 2021CF000264, 2021CF000279, 2021CF000289, 2022CF000036, 2022CF000081, 2022CF000148, 2022CF000152, and 2022CF000163 called together.  Defendant Brian L Bearheart in court.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Brian L Bearheart.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def waives all in person hearing KIV. Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Gill: def pleading to Cts 1, 4, and 7 of 19CF269; Ct 1 of 21CF262; Cts 1 and 5 in 22CF36; Ct 1 of 22CF148; Ct 5 of 22CF152; requesting PSI, parties free to argue. Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands. Court asks for pleas. Def enters pleas of Guilty.  Court finds def is making pleas knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the pleas.  Court finds defendant guilty of Cts 1, 4, and 7 of 19CF269; Ct 1 of 21CF262; Cts 1 and 5 in 22CF36; Ct 1 of 22CF148; Ct 5 of 22CF152 and orders a JOC remaining counts and cases 21CF154, 21CF264, 21CF279, 21Cf289, 22CF81, and 22CF163 are DRI.  Court orders PSI, long form, agent does not need to be present, but should be available by phone- if needed- for sentencing hearing.  Bond is revoked.  All parties are to appear in person for SEH.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Plea hearing on October 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:34 AM Cases 19CF269, 2021CF000154, 2021CF000262, 2021CF000264, 2021CF000279, 2021CF000289, 2022CF000036, 2022CF000081, 2022CF000148, 2022CF000152, and 2022CF000163 called together.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian L Bearheart appeared by video, in custody, appearing from Bayfield County Jail.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Brian L Bearheart. Cases 22CF148, 22CF152, and 22CF163 scheduled for preliminary hearings; all others on for status conferences.  Atty Gill notes def is waiving the prelim in all 3 files set for prelim today.  Def waives all in person hearing KIV.  Cases 22CF148, 22CF152, and 22CF163 proceed to Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files informations mirroring complaints in all three cases.  Cases proceed to arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Atty Gill updates- asks for plea hearing 6-8 weeks out and def considering programming prior to plea; current offer/s recited by atty Gill, pleas to 8 felonies, PSI, free to argue.  Discussion of offer.  Bond continues.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on August 17, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:43 PM Cases 19CF269, 2021CF000154, 2021CF000262, 2021CF000264, 2021CF000279, 2021CF000289, 2022CF000036, 2022CF000081, 2022CF000148, 2022CF000152, 2022CF000163 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian L Bearheart appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Brian L Bearheart.   Cases 2022CF000148, 2022CF000152, and 2022CF000163 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Def enters NG pleas to misdemeanors.  WTLPH.  Preliminary Hearings set in 2022CF000148, 2022CF000152, 2022CF000163.  Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:02 AM 19CF269, 2021CF000154, 2021CF000262, 2021CF000264, 2021CF000279, 2021CF000289, 2022CF000036, 2022CF000081, 2022CF000148, 2022CF000152, and 22CF153 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian L Bearheart appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by phone for Brian L Bearheart.  Cases were set to resolve, but def has new cases recently filed, will not be resolving via plea today.Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian L Bearheart appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by phone for Brian L Bearheart.  State requests to dismiss duplicate file 22CF153; Court dismisses 22CF153.  State notes a global resolution offer has been made: plead to 8 felonies- Ct 1, 4, and 7 in 19CF269, Ct 1 in 21CF262, Cts 1 and 5 in 22CF36, Ct 3 in 22CF148, and Ct 1 in 22CF152; DRI balance, PSI, parties free to argue.  Atty Gill needs time to talk to def.  Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

The defendant must post $10,000 additional cash bond to be released from custody.  This bond to cover Burnett County cases 21CF279, 21CF264, 21CF262, 21CF154, 19CF269, 21CF289, 22CF36, 22CF81, and new allegations filed in 22GF166 and 22GF173.  No contact with 24750 Angeline Ave, Webster WI.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No use or possession of firearms.  No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.  No contact with any of the victims, their residences, or their businesses or places of employment.  No contact with Lipsie Pines Tavern. No contact with the victim, or residence, or dog in case 21CF289.
Plea hearing on June 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:28 PM 19CF269, 21CF154, 21CF262, 21CF264, 21CF279, 21CF289, 22CF36, and 22CF81 called together.Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian L Bearheart in court.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Brian L Bearheart. Court recaps case- cases not going through with plea today.  Bond continues.
Plea hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea hearing on June 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

11:48 AM Called 19CF269, 21CF154, 21CF262, 21CF264, 21CF279 and 21CF289 for STC and 22CF36 and 22CF81 scheduled for PH. Defendant Brian Lee Bearheart in court with attorney Cheryl Marie Gill.  Defendant in custody, appears by video from Barron Co Jail. DA James Jay Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Brian Lee Bearheart appeared by video means with Attorney by separate video.  Def and Attny enter break-out session at 11:49am.  Resume, same appearances as previously noted, at 11:51am. Attny Gill and def confirm 2 cases, 22CF36 and 22CF81, on for Waiver of Preliminary Hearings:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information which mirror the criminal complaints for both cases.  Both Cases on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts in both cases.  DA confirms global offer has been presented.  Recites plead to counts 1, 4 & 7 in 19CF269, DRI all other counts and cases, PSI, free to argue, Attny Gill notes old offer. Attny Gill notes global offer received March 3, 2022 but doesn't include 22CF81: plead to counts 1, 4 & 7 in 19CF269, and count 1 in 21CF262 and counts 1 & 5 in 22CF36, assume rest DRI.  State confirms 22CF81 would be DRI, and PSI, free to argue.  Officers free to go.  Def and Attny enter breakout room at 11:59am.  Resume, same appearances as previously noted, at 12:02pm.  Set for tentative plea.  Bond continues.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
